citation.article-title: Reclassification of Clostridium quercicolum as Dendrosporobacter quercicolus gen. nov., comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Dendrosporobacter (Den.dro.spo.ro.bac«ter. Gr. n. dendro tree ; Gr. n. spora seed, spore; M.L. n. bacter equivalent of Gr. neut. n. bakterion rod, staff; M.L. masc. n. Dendrosporobacter a spore-bearing rod from a tree)
Cells are straight, motile rods with a Gram-negative cell wall.
Endospores are formed. `Lipid F', with octa- and nonaprenologues (ratio approx. 1:1) as the predominant isoprenologues, is present, but no cytochromes.
Predominant polar lipids are phosphatidyl ethanolamine, phosphatidyl serine and an unidentified glycolipid, together with a number of minor phospholipids and unidentified components.
3-Hydroxy fatty acids (3-OH 11:0, 3-OH 12:0 and 3-OH 13:0) are present in the fatty acids, approximately half of which are not esterified.
The predominant nonhydroxylated fatty acids are 11:0, 15:1, 15:0 and 17:1.
Major products in PY-fructose broth are acetate, propionate, propanol and H2.
The G+C content of the DNA is 48.5 mol% (HPLC) or 52-54 mol% (Tm).
The type species is Dendrosporobacter quercicolus comb. nov.
